meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be computed or calculated.
meanings.sent1: The computability of the math problem made it easy to solve.
meanings.sent2: The computability of the data allowed for quick analysis.
meanings.sent3: The computability of the recipe made it a breeze to follow.
meanings.sent4: Her mind's computability was like a well-oiled machine, always processing information efficiently.
meanings.sent5: The computability of the puzzle made it enjoyable to solve.

meanings.definition: The ability of a system or machine to perform computations or solve problems.
meanings.sent1: The new software's computability impressed the team with its speed.
meanings.sent2: The computability of the robot allowed it to complete tasks autonomously.
meanings.sent3: The computability of the coffee machine made it seem like a genius barista.
meanings.sent4: The computability of the engine was crucial for the car's performance on the track.
meanings.sent5: The computability of the calculator made math class much easier.
